A group of 50 students took a statistics test. The average score on the test was 75 with a standard deviation of 10. The teacher believes that students with higher GPAs tend to perform better on the test. Assume that the GPA of the population of students follows a normal distribution with a mean of 3.0 and a standard deviation of 0.5. 

Based on this information, if a student has a GPA of 3.5, what is the probability that they will score above an 80 on the statistics test, assuming Bayesian statistics?

z = (80 - 75) / 10 = 0.5

Using a z-table or calculator, we find that the probability of a z-score being greater than 0.5 is approximately 0.3085. So, P(Test Score > 80) = 0.3085.
